pages.text: While inorganic, minerals, from gems to stones to metals, are just as important in Witchcraft.

pages.title: Coquina
pages.text: A type of sedimentary stone found on Beaches. This stone has a powerful connection to the oceans and is in fact composed of the remains of shellfish.

pages.title: Amethyst
pages.text: An incredibly popular purple crystal. It is used to help boost offensive magics, and some claim it can affect health positively.

pages.title: Garnet
pages.text: A gemstone with a deep red-purple hue. This gem is very good at protecting from evil magics, and as such, has defensive properties.

pages.title: Opal
pages.text: A whitish gem known for its “play of colour” or “fire”, a brilliant light show that changes based on how its held. This gem aids support-based magic, such as enhancing powers.

pages.title: Salt
pages.text: A mineral found fairly shallow underground. While seeming rather inconspicuous, salt is used to protect against all forms of supernatural creatures, acting as a physical barrier of sorts towards them.

pages.title: Silver
pages.text: A brilliant metal, next to only gold. Representing the moon as well as purity, silver is a coveted metal used in many magical devices. It also finds widespread use in slaying supernatural beings, commonly werewolves, but vampires and other undead are also harmed by it.
